minihud.config.generic.comment.axolotlTo: Adds the Axolotl variant name to the bucket tooltip
minihud.config.generic.comment.beeToolti: Adds the number of contained bees to the tooltip of Bee Hive and Bee Nest items
minihud.config.generic.comment.honeyTool: Adds the honey level to the tooltip of Bee Hive and Bee Nest items
minihud.config.generic.comment.biomeOver: The horizontal chunk radius to render for the Biome Border Overlay
The vertical (sub-)chunk radius to render for the Biome Border Overlay

If enabled, then the Biome Border Overlay will use
the same color for all biomes. This can look "less messy"
when the adjacent biome's colors and lines aren't blending
into a huge mess of colors.
minihud.config.generic.comment.blockPosF:
The format string for the "infoBlockPosition" line.
Needs to have three %d format strings!
Default: "Block: %d, %d, %d"
minihud.config.generic.comment.blockGrid: The radius of the block grid lines to render
minihud.config.generic.comment.coordinat:
The format string for the coordinate line.
Needs to have three %f format strings!
Default: x: %.1f y: %.1f z: %.1f
minihud.config.generic.comment.dateForma:
The format string for real time, see the Java SimpleDateFormat
class for the format patterns, if needed.

The format string for the Minecraft time.
The supported placeholders are: {DAY_1}, {DAY}, {HOUR}, {MIN}, {SEC}, {MOON}.
{DAY_1} starts the day counter from 1, {DAY} starts from 0.
minihud.config.generic.comment.debugMess: Enables some debug messages in the game console
minihud.config.generic.comment.debugRend:
If true, then the vanilla pathfinding debug renderer
will render the path point width boxes.
minihud.config.generic.comment.dontClear:
Don't clear the stored world seed when just changing dimensions.
Some mods may use per-dimension seeds, so you may need to change
this in case the different dimensions on your server/mod pack
have different world seeds.
minihud.config.generic.comment.entityDat:
Use the Entity Data Sync protocol from Servux
to obtain Entity Data from the server

Use the Vanilla NBT Query method when Servux
is not available.  This method requires Operator Privileges.
minihud.config.generic.comment.enableVan: If true, then the vanilla debug renderer OpenGL state is fixed.
minihud.config.generic.comment.fontScale: Font scale factor for the info line HUD. Default: 0.5
minihud.config.generic.comment.hudAlignm: The alignment of the info line HUD
minihud.config.generic.comment.inventory: The key to activate the inventory preview feature

Enable/Disable the Inventory Preview Feature
Made so you can individually enable / disable this feature

Open a screen for inventory preview
You can use your mouse to see tooltips
minihud.config.generic.comment.lightLeve:
If enabled, then the Light Level overlay will be
automatically raised to render on top of the block's shape.
§6Note: This will make the overlay also render
§6on top of things like slabs, where mobs will not be able to spawn,
§6unless you turn on the collision check option as well.

Whether to use colored or white numbers
for the Light Level overlay numbers

If enabled, then the Light Level overlay is not rendered
if there is any block with a collision box in the way.
§6Note: This is not a proper check for spawnability!
§6This would omit any block even partially sticking into the lower spawn block!
§6For example open trapdoors or doors would prevent the overlay from showing.
When to render the colored light level marker

Which type of colored marker to use in the
Light Level overlay, if any

The size of the light level colored marker.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0
When to render the light level number
Which light level number(s) to render in the Light Level overlay

The relative "x" offset for the block light level number.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0

The relative "y" offset for the block light level number.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0

The relative "x" offset for the sky light level number.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0

The relative "y" offset for the sky light level number.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0

If true, then the light level numbers will rotate
according to the player's current facing
The block range to render the Light Level overlay in

The relative render offset for the light level overlay.
Meant to help with potential z-fighting issues with the block surface.
Range: 0.0 - 1.0

If enabled, then the Light Level overlay
will be rendered through blocks

Should the Light Level Overlay skip the spawnability
check of the block below. This would make the
overlay also appear on top of slabs and glass etc.

The §omaximum§r light level which is considered "dim".
This is an optional user-configurable extra level between "dark" and "safe".
Set it below the safe threshold to disable it.
The light level threshold which is considered safe
Should the light level overlay render under water
minihud.config.generic.comment.mainRende:
The main rendering toggle for all MiniHUD rendering,
including the info lines AND all the overlay renderers
minihud.config.generic.comment.mapPrevie:
Enables rendering a preview of the map,
when you hold shift while hovering over a map item
Whether holding shift is required for the Map Preview
The size of the rendered map previews
minihud.config.generic.comment.moveShape:
Move the currently selected shape to the player's
(or the camera's) current location
minihud.config.generic.comment.offsetSub:
If the Info Lines HUD is set to the bottom right corner,
and subtitles are enabled, then the subtitles will
be offset to appear above the Info Lines text.
minihud.config.generic.comment.openConfi: A hotkey to open the in-game Config GUI
minihud.config.generic.comment.requireSn: Require the player to be sneaking to render the info line HUD
minihud.config.generic.comment.requiredK: Require holding this key to render the HUD
minihud.config.generic.comment.serverNbt: Limit request rate for server entity data syncer
minihud.config.generic.comment.setDistan:
A hotkey to store the player's current position
as the reference point for the distance info line type
minihud.config.generic.comment.shapeEdit: Opens the Shape Editor GUI for the selected shape
minihud.config.generic.comment.shulkerBo:
Enables rendering a preview of the Shulker Box contents,
when you hold shift while hovering over a Shulker Box item
minihud.config.generic.comment.shulkerDi:
Enables tinting/coloring the Shulker Box display
background texture with the dye color of the box
Whether or not holding shift is required for the Shulker Box preview
minihud.config.generic.comment.slimeChun:
If enabled, then the slime chunk overlay's top position
is set to the player's y-position when the overlay is turned on.
If disabled, then the top is set to y = 40 when the overlay is turned on.

The radius of chunks to render the slime chunk overlay in.
Valid range: -1 ... 40, where -1 = render distance
minihud.config.generic.comment.sortLines: Sort the lines by their text's length
minihud.config.generic.comment.spawnPlay: Enables the Player-Following render for the Outer Spawn Radius Border (Purple)
Enables the Player-Following render for the Redstone Spawn Radius Border (Yellow)
minihud.config.generic.comment.spawnReal: Enables the Real World Spawn render for the Outer Spawn Radius Border (Brown)
Enables the Real World Spawn render for the Redstone Spawn Radius Border (Yellow)
minihud.config.generic.comment.spawnable:
The radius (in blocks) to render the spawnable
column heights overlay in. Valid range: 0 - 128
minihud.config.generic.comment.structure:
If enabled, then the Structure Bounding Boxes
will be rendered through blocks
minihud.config.generic.comment.textPosX: Text X position from the screen edge (default: 4)
minihud.config.generic.comment.textPosY: Text Y position from the screen edge (default: 4)
minihud.config.generic.comment.timeDayDi: The divisor value for the modulo of the day time
minihud.config.generic.comment.timeTotal: The divisor value for the modulo of the total world time
minihud.config.generic.comment.useCustom: Use the customized coordinate format string
minihud.config.generic.comment.useTextBa: Use a solid background color behind the text
minihud.config.generic.comment.villagerC: Show the conversion ticks for zombie villagers
minihud.config.generic.comment.villagerO: Show villager offers for enchanted books
Show only villager offers for the highest level enchanted books
Only show villager offers with the lowest price for the same enchantment

Only show villager offers with prices below this ratio
Set to 1.0 to display all offers
minihud.config.colors.comment.beaconRang: Color for the Beacon Range lvl 1 overlay
Color for the Beacon Range lvl 2 overlay
Color for the Beacon Range lvl 3 overlay
Color for the Beacon Range lvl 4 overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.blockGridO: Color for the block grid overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.conduitRan: Color for the Conduit Range overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.lightLevel: The color for the safe (during day) spots marker
The color for the spawnable spots marker
The color for the "dim" marker (user-definable level)
The color for the safe (during day) spots marker
The color for the spawnable spots number of the block light value
The color for the "dim" (user-definable level) block light number
The color for the safe spots number of the block light value
The color for the spawnable spots number of the sky light value
The color for the "dim" (user-definable level) sky light number
The color for the safe spots number of the sky light value
minihud.config.colors.comment.randomTick: Color for the fixed-point random ticked chunks overlay
Color for the player-following random ticked chunks overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.regionOver: Color for the region file overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeAdjus:
Default color for the "Adjustable Spawn Sphere" overlay.
The color can be changed for each sphere via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeBox:
Default color for the Box shape
The color can be changed for each shape via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeCanDe:
Default color for the "Can Despawn Sphere" overlay.
The color can be changed for each sphere via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeCanSp:
Default color for the "Can Spawn Sphere" overlay.
The color can be changed for each sphere via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeCircl:
Default color for the Circle renderer.
The color can be changed for each shape via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeDespa:
Default color for the "Despawn Sphere" overlay.
The color can be changed for each sphere via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeLineB:
Default color for the Line (Blocky) renderer.
The color can be changed for each shape via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.shapeSpher:
Default color for the blocky/block-based Sphere renderer.
The color can be changed for each sphere via its configuration GUI.
minihud.config.colors.comment.slimeChunk: Color for the slime chunks overlay
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnPlaye:
Color for the entity-processing spawn chunks overlay of
how the spawn chunks would be if the spawn were
to be at the player's current position
§aGreen - Entity Processing

Color for the "redstone-only" spawn chunks overlay of
how the spawn chunks would be if the spawn were
to be at the player's current position,
§eYellow - Redstone Processing (Default: off)

Color for the "lazy-loaded" spawn chunks overlay of
how the spawn chunks would be if the spawn were
to be at the player's current position,
§cRed - Mob Caps only (aka lazy/border chunk)

Color for the 1.14+ outer loaded spawn chunks overlay of
how the spawn chunks would be if the spawn were
to be at the player's current position,
§6Brown - Outer limits for chunk loading,
§6for things like World gen and rendering (Default: off)
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnRealE:
Color for the entity-processing real spawn chunks overlay
§9Blue - Entity Processing
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnRealR:
Color for the "redstone-only" real spawn chunks overlay,
§eYellow - Redstone Processing (Default: off)
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnRealL:
Color for the "lazy-loaded" real spawn chunks overlay,
§dMagenta - Mob Caps only (aka lazy/border chunk)
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnRealO:
Color for the 1.14+ outer loaded real spawn chunks overlay,
§5Purple - Outer limits for chunk loading,
§5for things like World gen and rendering (Default: off)
minihud.config.colors.comment.spawnableC: Color for the spawnable sub-chunks overlay
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoB:
Show the number of bees in the targeted Hive or Nest.
§6Note: This only works in single player (without server-side support,
§6which doesn't exist yet, but will be in the Servux mod at some point).
Show the name of the current biome
Show the registry name of the current biome

Show the player's current block breaking speed
over the last 100 ticks (5 seconds)
Show the player's current position within the Chunk
Show the player's current block position
Show the BlockState properties and values
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoC: Show the Chunk the player is currently within

Show the currently rendered number of
Chunk sections (the C value from F3)
Show the entire line of the C value from the F3 screen
Show the current number of chunk updates per second

Show the player's coordinates scaled by the dimension's scale factor.
Only works in the overworld and the nether,
and assumes the vanilla nether portal scaling factor.
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoD:
Show the current dimension ID
(might not be accurate in every case,
depending on the server (Sponge?)!)

Show the distance to the current reference point.
Set the reference point with the setDistanceReferencePoint hotkey
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoE: Show the entity count in the world list/map

Show the registry name of the entity
the player is currently looking at
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoF:
Show the amount of XP in the looked at Furnace.
§6Note: This only works in single player (without server-side support,
§6which doesn't exist yet, but will be in the Servux mod at some point).
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoH:
Show the honey level the targeted Hive or Nest.
Note: This only works in single player (without server-side support,
§6which doesn't exist yet, but will be in the Servux mod at some point).
Show the speed (m/s) of the horse being ridden.
Show the jump height of the horse being ridden.
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoL: Show which block the player is currently looking at

Show which block within its containing chunk
the player is currently looking at

Show the entity name and health when looked at.
More data can be seen if used with Servux

Show the entities active status effects when looked at.
More data can be seen if used with Servux
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoM: Show the memory usage and allocation

Show the mob caps

§dNote: Currently only works on Carpet servers!
§6The data is currently only parsed from the player list footer on Carpet servers,
§6if you have subscribed to the data with '/log mobcaps'
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoL: Show the number of loaded chunks on the client
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoP: Show the gene of the panda being looked at
Show the currently renderer particle count (P from F3)
Show the current ping to the server
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoR: Show the region file the player is currently within
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoS:
Show the server TPS and ms/tick (MSPT) values
Note: This is only accurate when running a Carpet server
and the TPS display carpet rule is enabled.
Otherwise it is estimated on the client side,
based on the world time update packet, and it can
only detect TPS values lower than 20 that way.
Show Servux version and entity data sync protocol version

Show whether the player is currently in a slime chunk.
NOTE: This only works in single player without any user intervention!
On a server the player needs to either:
  1) be admin/OP and run the /seed command manually EVERY TIME
     they join or change dimensions, or
  2) input the seed via chat, by sending a "command" like: minihud-seed 12345
Show the player's current moving speed
Show the player's current moving speed per axis
Show the player's current moving speed both horizontally and vertically.
Show the "Sprinting" info line if the player is sprinting
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoT: Show the number of TileEntities in the client world

Show a modulo of the current day time.
See Generic configs for the divisor.
Show the current real time formatted according to dateFormatReal

Show a modulo of the current total world time.
See Generic configs for the divisor.
Show the current world time in ticks
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoW: Show the current world time formatted to days, hours, minutes
minihud.config.info_toggle.comment.infoZ: Show the Time that a Zombie Villager has until Conversion
minihud.config.render_toggle.comment.ove: Toggle the Beacon Range overlay renderer
Toggle the Biome Border overlay renderer
Toggle the Block Grid overlay renderer
Toggle the Conduit Range overlay renderer
Toggle the Light Level overlay renderer
Toggle the fixed-point random ticked chunks overlay renderer
Toggle the player-following random ticked chunks overlay renderer
Toggle the region file border overlay renderer
Toggle the Slime Chunk overlay renderer
Toggle the spawnable column heights overlay renderer

Toggle the spawn chunks overlay renderer
§aGreen - Entity Processing
§eYellow - Redstone Processing (Default: off)
§cRed - Mob Caps only (aka lazy/border chunk)
§6Brown - Outer limits for chunk loading,
§6for things like World gen and rendering (Default: off)

Toggle the pseudo (player-following) spawn chunks overlay renderer,
based on the simulation distance
§9Blue - Entity Processing
§eYellow - Redstone Processing (Default: off)
§dMagenta - Mob Caps only (aka lazy/border chunk)
§5Purple - Outer limits for chunk loading,
§5for things like World gen and rendering (Default: off)
Main toggle for all structure bounding boxes

Toggle the villager offers render.
Displays he enchantment books it sells.
minihud.config.render_toggle.comment.sha: The main toggle for the shape renderer
minihud.config.render_toggle.comment.deb: Toggles the vanilla Chunk Border debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Chunk Info debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Chunk Occlusion debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Block Collision Boxes debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Block Neighbor Updates debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Pathfinding debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Block Solid Faces debug renderer
Toggles the vanilla Water debug renderer
Toggle Ancient City structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Bastion Remnant structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Buried Treasure structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Desert Pyramid structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle End City structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Igloo structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Jungle Temple structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Mansion structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Mineshaft structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Nether Fortress structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Nether Fossil structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Ocean Monument structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Ocean Ruin structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Pillager Outpost structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Ruined Portal structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Shipwreck structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Stronghold structure bounding boxes rendering

Toggle Village structure bounding boxes rendering
NOTE: This is the Village world gen structures!
This is not the Village data you use for iron farms etc.!
Toggle Witch Hut structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Trail Ruins structure bounding boxes rendering
Toggle Unknown structure bounding boxes rendering
§7Corner Quadrants uses basically 4 separate spheres at the corners
§7of the rectangle area defined by the center and the margin distance.
§7The corner quadrants was the old behavior, and it gets derpy (especially on the
§7cardinal sides) if the margin increases to more than a few blocks.
§7The new default is not using the corner quadrants anymore,
§7but instead to kind of "slide the sphere around the margin perimeter"
§7to create the final shape.

minihud.label.bee_tooltip.name: §7- %s

minihud.message.toggled_debug_mode.heigh: Toggled Height Map debug rendering to %s

minihud.message.toggled_debug_mode.solid: Toggled Solid Faces debug rendering to %s

minihud.message.error.invalid_seed: Failed to parse the world seed from chat
minihud.message.error.invalid_spawn_chun: Failed to parse the spawn chunk radius from chat (0 < 32)

minihud.message.seed_is: The world seed in MiniHUD is currently set to '%s'
